; Thu, 02 Nov 2023 08:25:04 +0800 书城伏案的侧影：写在刘世南先生百年诞辰之际http://www.infzm.com/contents/259765
;;2023-11-01 23:00:00;
;

;;

;

;Mr. Liu Shinan took a photo in front of the Chongshao Library of Jiangxi Normal University. ;(Photo courtesy of Li Taosheng);

;

;;People who long for friends who fear friends;

;

;Liu Shinan Mr. (1923-2021) was a fighter. This is the first impression of him by people who are familiar with him and those who are not familiar with him. He dared to criticize various scholars, including those older than him, those of his generation, and those younger than him. His articles were scattered in various books and periodicals from the late 1970s to the new century, making readers People who feel the enthusiasm and persistence of his criticism are of course embarrassed by the critics, but they do learn from him, and many criticized scholars express their gratitude to him and respect him even more. His criticisms were actually aimed at problems, especially the style of study. His straightforward writing style contained a profound call for sincerity, simplicity, seriousness, and a down-to-earth style of study.

;

;Not many people know that he is very eager to be criticized. He criticized Mr. Liu Mengfu ("Outside the Academic Hall" page 301), and Mr. Mengfu also criticized him. He invited Mr. Mengfu to write a preface to his "Daluo Ju Shi Cun". Mr. Mengfu wrote a long preface in which he included his own critical opinions. He criticized it with real swords and guns. Mr. Shinan did not think that Sorry, let it remain in the preface as it is. This is the style of sincerity and magnanimity. He said in a letter to me on July 26, 2005:

;

;;Mr. Liu Mengfu is middle-aged and a poet. Learn the art of poetry and achieve the best of both worlds. He looks down upon him as a servant, looks down upon his followers, and is sincerely afraid of his friends. ;

;

;He respects and looks forward to his "fearful friends". When he heard Mr. Tao Wenpeng mention that some parts of his "History of Qing Poetry Schools" were a bit "old", he wrote a letter asking Mr. Tao to point out his shortcomings in detail. Mr. Tao replied, and Mr. Shinan made a copy of the letter. Send me a copy and write:

;

;;Send me a copy of Mr. Tao Wenpeng’s letter, to be compared with Mr. Tao Wenpeng’s book review Although Mr. Yun and Mr. Tao made many mistakes in their compliments, Mr. Tao was able to correct their flaws. I hope Mr. Yun can do the same. In the past, Chen Si once said: "The writings of the world cannot be without disease. I always have good people to ridicule my writings, and if there are bad ones, I should revise them in due course." He also quoted Ding Jingli and said: "Who in future generations will know that my writings are evil?" I hope that Mr. Zou Zhen, as the editor-in-chief of "History of Qing Poetry Schools", will be able to rectify the shortcomings of my book and inform future generations of those who govern Qing poetry about what to avoid. This is the meaning of an academic public instrument. (January 12, 2005);

;

;It can be seen that he is still not satisfied with Mr. Tao's criticism and hopes to get more and more real criticism. He regards criticism as an "academic official tool". "To look at it. This allows us to understand more clearly that the reason why he carried out academic criticism with all his might was because he really had no selfish motives and was only dedicated to the healthy and mature development of the academic world. His attitude towards criticism is not only aimed at others, but also aimed at himself, which is conducive to his own improvement and is conducive to clear understanding in the academic community. He sets an example and has a bright mind, which is admirable.

;

;;

;

;Professor Liu Shinan and his "Detailed Notes on Three Hundred Qing Poems". ;(Information picture/picture);

;

;He was very moved by others' corrections to him and expressed his gratitude repeatedly. Our publisher was planning to launch chronological anthologies one after another. Considering that Mr. Shinan was familiar with Qing literature, editor and editor Zhou Xuanlong, then director of the Classics Department, sincerely invited him to annotate "Selected Works of the Qing Dynasty". Considering that time was tight, he asked his Student Professor Liu Songlai assisted. After the manuscript arrived, Ms. Wen Lichen, a graduate student at Beijing Normal University, intern, reviewed it for the first time under my guidance. Then I reviewed it again. After writing two revisions, I sent it to Mr. Shinan for review. He said in a letter written in the Provincial Library on October 1, 2005:

;

;;September 22 and Review comments and copies of book reviews have been received. Please read them. After reading it, I feel ashamed and excited! ;

;

;From the articles of Kuangzheng and Supplement, we can also see that Mr. Wen Lichen and Wen Lichen have made profound achievements in the study of female history, and their admiration for them cannot be overstated! I secretly say that the "Selected Works of the Qing Dynasty" will be of some benefit to this world in the future. It shows that the cooperation between the four of us is not caused by Song Lai and me. I plan to add a few words to the preface of this book to clarify the meaning and to show that we do not dare to take advantage of beauty.

;

;He later insisted on adding words of praise to me and Xiaowen in the preface of the book, which shows that he was happy after hearing about it and had an open-minded and sage mind, which was like a spring breeze.

;

;;

;

;Professor Liu Shinan’s two works. ;(Information picture/picture);

;

;;"A silverfish in the book of life and death";

;

; Mr. Shinan's fighting spirit is mainly reflected in his diligent reading and writing.

;

;He does not have many books, mainly because the collections of two generations of his were destroyed during the special period, which made him extremely sad, and he generally stopped buying books ("Odd Records of Masters and Friends", page 117). He mainly visits the library. He is a frequent visitor to the provincial library and school library. In 1994, after fourteen years of arduous reading, research, and writing, he finally completed "History of the Qing Poetry School". When proofreading the manuscript the following summer, he reviewed the process with joy:

; < p>;;Reminiscent of the past, when every year passes, the bookstore is still busy with calligraphy. ;

;

;;Wan Jiaqing Tuanluan, sitting alone and smiling. ;

;

;;The box is full of cards, and there are more than delicious meals. ;

;

;;After fourteen years of hard work, the book is finished with a pen and inkstone. ;

;

;;(Appendix to "History of Qing Poetry Schools" "Proofreading in the Midsummer of Jiaxu" "History of Qing Poetry Schools" Manuscript...");

;

;Note: "Every Spring Festival and New Year's Eve, I sit in the library, facing the administrator from a distance." Our publisher is preparing to publish the simplified version, and I am honored to be responsible. The editor, during the editing process, greeted him and mentioned this impressive scene. He wrote me a reply in the sample library on the evening of December 30, 2003 and the next day:

;

;< span style="font-family: Kaiti, Kaiti_GB2312, STKaiti;">;Thank you for your attention. You still remember that I was still sitting in the library on New Year's Eve. If school maps were still open, I would indeed do that. ;

;

;;"A silverfish in the book of life and death", this is how I have been here all my life. ;

;

;Indeed, he still couldn't let go every day. One New Year's Eve, the curator and he "faced each other from a distance", which was quite a scene. He wrote to his student Professor Guo Dan: "It is now nearly 4 o'clock in the afternoon on New Year's Eve. Director Zhang and I are the only two people left in the library reading hall; Director Zhang is on duty in person and will accompany me until 4 o'clock with a smile. The bell closes the door." (Guo Dan's "The Realm of Scholarship and the Style of Personality - A Note on Mr. Liu Shinan", "Occasions of Teachers and Friends", page 237) Such a curator is really a good curator, and such a reader is really a good reader. This is called It is a good story in the contemporary reading world. The postcard he sent me on December 31, 2006 said:

;

;;The bookstore is sitting at the desk, cocooning and feeling pity, forgetting Time passes in a hurry. ;

;

;;If Hua Yan was not drunk this night, who would have known that the day after tomorrow would be the New Year. ;

;

;Still reading on New Year’s Eve, it is indeed the style of reading seeds. Of course, he didn't just focus on New Year's Eve. In fact, every day was precious to him. Letter from June 4, 2004:

;

;;"Selected Works of the Qing Dynasty" is very busy, I have never been so nervous , because the school will be closed during the summer vacation, so I have to finish this before the vacation. ;

;

;This is the scene when I was rushing to select and annotate "Selected Works of the Qing Dynasty" with Professor Song Lai. Later, when there was no urgent work, I still went to the library unremittingly. In the past, revolutionaries had a heroic saying: "Sit through the prison." Mr. Shinan, in his old age, still insisted on going there regardless of his illness. He really had the spirit to penetrate the library. The letter dated January 10, 2013 said:

;

;;One ​​year has passed and I was recently hospitalized for removal of nasal warts. Medical advice It was basal cell carcinoma and had been completely removed. I am already ninety years old and have lived and died for a long time, so after I was discharged from the hospital, I still sat in the library. ;

;

;When Professor Guo Dan called Mr. Shinan to wish him a happy New Year on the morning of the first day of the Spring Festival in Year Yiwei in 2015, the answer he heard was "I am already reading in the provincial library"! (Postscript to the reprint of "Occasions of Teachers and Friends") Mr. Li Taosheng has been accompanying Mr. Shinan for many years. He said in the article "Unforgettable words from the bottom of my heart": "Books are all his spiritual sustenance." "No matter the wind, frost, rain or snow, he always He would always show up at the library on time like a staff member. He said he hoped he could die at his desk in the future." ("Occasions of Teachers and Friends", page 249) This shows how obsessed he is with books.

;

;;"From thousands of books";

;

;Mr. Shinan has read extensively and is particularly familiar with classics and history, so he can read many treatises We are sensitive to misunderstandings, misjudgments, and corrections and can provide corrections. In addition to helping others publish absurdities, he mainly devoted his energy to the research and writing of "History of Qing Poetry Schools". In addition, a lot of study was done on the annotations of "Selected Works of the Qing Dynasty". After taking on this task, he devoted himself wholeheartedly to the selection of articles. Although Professor Song Lai was invited to participate in the annotation work, he still did everything personally:

;

;;From text selection to punctuation to the comments, I will read them all and revise them. ;

;

;;At these times, I was busy selecting articles, mainly from "Sikuquanshu" and "Continued" Choose from "Xiu Siku Quanshu" and "Cunmu Series", and a few have to be found separately from the thread-bound library. For example, Jiang Shiquan has no text in "Continued Cultivation", but "Pictures of Night Classes with Sound Machines" must be selected. Others can be deduced by analogy. The selection of the text is time-consuming. After selecting it, it must be photocopied and then hand-copied into simplified Chinese characters. (December 16, 2003) ;

;

;In order to concentrate on the work of "Selected Works of the Qing Dynasty", he served as the chief academic consultant for the compilation of "Yu Zhang Series" in Jiangxi Province universities for several years. (that is, final check) also resigned. This shows his determination to devote himself wholeheartedly to the work of "Selected Works of the Qing Dynasty". Because he was familiar with the collected works of the Qing Dynasty, and he read them day and night, by December 30, 2003, he had "read page by page the Qing Dynasty Collection of Continuing the Complete Collection of Siku Quanshu", and had reached 154 of the 188 volumes. , there are still 30 volumes left, I can finish them before the winter vacation," and said, "Then I will read "Sikuquanshu", there are not many collections. I haven't read "Cunmu", so I don't know how many." In selecting articles, "Be sure not to show off your hands and eyes, and don't be attracted by people's enthusiasm" (letter dated December 30, 2003). In this letter, he still could not hide his critical eye and expressed his opinions on several books.

;

;;I was reading the collected works of Zeng Guofan today, and I found four books that were annotated by modern people. Take "Yuancai" as an example , Tu Xiaoma's version, Lai Xinxia's version, and Guo Yuheng's version all concluded: "Is it possible to say that it is not false?" "Is it possible to say that it is not false?" On the contrary, Zheng Zhenduo's "Late Qing Dynasty" "Selected Works" concluded: "Is it true to say that the accusation is not false?" That's right. Tu, Lai and Guo...I don't know that the "ye" in "Ke Hu Ye" is actually "ye". Books such as "Jing Zhuan Shi Ci" make it very clear, and the ancient prose written by Han Yu and Ouyang Xiu is swaying and often colorful. There is this aria. ;

;

;In addition, the "king" in "Everyone is king and is ordered to do so" has been misunderstood. "Mistakenly changed to "must", it is also analyzed. He did not deny your contribution, he just wanted to explain that he would learn from their achievements, but would never simply plagiarize:

;

;;Even if we refer to this kind of annotated version, we must analyze every detail, never make vague and influential remarks, but strive to be clear and accurate. ;

;

;There are actually very few similar works that we can rely on. Even if we refer to them, they must be adopted with discernment. This is in line with what Mr. Shinan has always advocated: "Speak from the heart, never tamper with a single word." academic spirit.

;

;By June 26, 2004, it was the final stage of "Selected Works of the Qing Dynasty". He wrote to me to introduce the writing situation of the preface of the book:

;

;;The preface can prove that the two of us have a slightly new understanding of Qingwen and do not follow what others say, precisely because we have put a lot of effort into the annotation of the works. For example, "the genre is single but the styles are diverse", we not only pointed out "how it is" but also explained "why it is so". This is the characteristic of our learning. It is also aimed at traditional Chinese literary criticism. The traditional method is improvisational and perceptive, and only points out "how it is" without analyzing "why it is so". We have accepted the influence of Western academics and always like to pursue a "why". Therefore, with regard to the emergence of the Tongcheng School (including the later Yanghu School and the Xiangxiang School) and the praise of "all the articles in the world can only be found in Tongcheng", we try to find out its logical inevitability through this phenomenon. There are always laws to follow in phenomena, among which the law of cause and effect is most worth pondering, and the results of pondering are also the most thought-provoking. ;

;

;Mr. Tao Wenpeng heard about this preface and immediately asked Mr. Shinan to publish it in "Literary Heritage" in advance. Mr. Shinan said in his letter on January 12, 2005:

;

;;Tao Jun asked to rewrite the preface of "Selected Works of the Qing Dynasty" For the thesis, I have cooperated with Song Laijun. However, Huamei may not be fashionable and Zhu Yi may not nod. But I can be confident that the words and sentences of these two people come from their hearts and come from thousands of books. There is no suppression or similarity. . ;

;

;The confidence reflected here comes from his steady reading and long-term cultivation. This spirit is reflected in his works and critical articles.

;

;The method of popularizing culture through book selection is traditional, but it is an effective method of cultural communication for thousands of years. However, few people are willing to take on such work now because it requires Investing a lot of energy requires a high level of appreciation, extensive knowledge reserves and profound cultural heritage. The art of annotation is extremely difficult to learn, and it can easily lead to mistakes. However, Mr. Shinan resolutely agreed to do the work of "Selected Works of the Qing Dynasty", which shows his confidence and responsibility. After the publication of this book, readers responded very well. Mr. Shinan was very happy and wrote a letter saying:

;

;;What will your company do next year? If there is a new topic that is suitable for me to work with, I hope it will be successful. Although Gai Pu is already old, his spirit has not faded, but he is itching again and again, and he is unhappy and unprepared to do anything. (Written in Provincial Map on October 1, 2005);

;

;It can be seen that he has the ambition of "being an old man, but aiming for a thousand miles". Considering that he is old and cannot be overworked, we did not invite him to do another one.

;

;;"Young Thinker";

;

;Mr. Shinan seems to be a bookworm while sitting in the library, but he is actually a "young thinker" ( Chen Ji's "Mr. Forever Young", "Occasionally Diary of Teachers and Friends"). In addition to "History of Qing Poetry Schools" and "Daluoju Poetry and Essays", Mr. Shinan also has "Outside the Academic Hall" revised and reprinted, and "Occasional Notes of Teachers and Friends". These two books are not "pure" books. , the collection is relatively mixed, the form is very random, but the theme is clear, they are all academic texts, and they are all "dry information". It preserves a large number of academic correspondence, collects some book reviews, talks about academic methods, and more importantly, the academic spirit. It is interesting. We also collected some opinions that differed from those of Mr. Shinan. He said in the preface of "Occasions of Teachers and Friends": "'The dispute is between gentlemen', and it is by no means a dispute of will. For me, it is 'I love my teacher, and I especially love the truth.'" He once again praised Mr. Mengfu, Praise him as a "critical friend" and "admire his courage to stick to the truth." Regarding this book with the theme of "I and the Intellectuals I Understand", Mr. Shinan said: "The nature of this book is similar to "The Inheritance of Sinology Teachers in the Kingdom of China". It is academic and can be used as a modern and contemporary book. Materials on academic history and intellectual history." Indeed, its content is more than an independent paper. It contains rich materials for contemporary scholars' ideological exchanges and even confrontations. It has great academic value and is undoubtedly a breakthrough in form. and pioneering. The letter dated July 18, 2004 stated:

;

;;You will feel that this is a picture of the times, which reflects the The vigorous fighting of the soul. It can leave a valuable legacy to future generations and let them know how intellectuals in our era are searching. ;

;

;The "External Edition" of this book includes an article "How do contemporary intellectuals inherit and carry forward the fine traditions of ancient Chinese scholars?" "" embodies his exploration on the ideological and spiritual level, letting people know that he is not a nerd, and his active mind and body surpass many young people.

;

;In academic research, he has direct and in-depth discussions. In terms of poetry creation, it also has profound meaning and is worth appreciating. On January 12, 2005, he wrote a letter to talk about his "Da Luo Ju Shi Cun":

;

;;Mr. , you will know that the humble poems are not works criticizing the wind and the moon, but are all words of crying and sighing. ;

;

;He said in the preface to "Shi Cun": "Any poem must be written for a purpose. It will never lament the old age and humbleness, but only the worries of the people, the country and the world." Many of his poems directly record reality, which makes people sigh and impress him with his broad mind.

;

;I felt that it took Mr. Yu fourteen years to write "History of Qing Poetry Schools". After the book was edited and published, I wrote a book review and published it in "Hainan Daily", which was later revised and published. In Guangming Daily. I sent it to Mr. Wang for review. He said in the letter dated June 4, 2004:

;

;;is busy working on "Selected Works of the Qing Dynasty" , I usually put the letter aside and reply later. I didn’t expect to receive your letter today, let alone read your book review. After reading the book review carefully, I burst into tears. ;

;

;;You may be wondering: Why am I so easily excited? There are about seven or eight book reviews about "History of Qing Poetry Schools", but I have never been so excited. As for you, as the editor-in-chief, you obviously read "History of Qing Poetry School" carefully, so you also carefully read "Outside the Academic Palace". In addition, you have superb appreciation, rich life experience, and correct ideological understanding. , can I write such a book review that makes me excited. The masterpiece is not long, but it all hits the point, especially the point of humanistic care, which only you dare to point out. Frankly speaking, when I wrote "History of Qing Poetry Schools", I really had the mentality of Confucius writing "Spring and Autumn" and Ma Qian writing "Historical Records". This point was only pointed out in a book review by Professor Wang Qizhen of our school, but the article seems not to have been published yet. But you coincide with Mr. Wang, which is the most gratifying thing for me. ;

;

;;Mr. Yunbo, please let me say a word of sincere gratitude: "Uncle Bao, you know how to take care of me. I am proud that Yu Qing will not be a guest." This is a couplet made up at random, all using "Historical Records", and I feel it is very relevant. Some people may question: How can people deal with things? Then I have to say it without any shame: Just consider yourself dead. ;

;

;My husband affirmed the book review I wrote. I have this confidence, but I never expected that it would make him "cry with emotion" and write "Uncle Bao knows how to manage" and so on. words of thanks; he directly confided his ambitions and pursuits, which shows that he didn't take anything for granted. In 2011, he recorded a super-star academic video, talking about "Me and the History of the Qing Poetry School" (later included in "Occasional Notes of Teachers and Friends"), and mentioned that "Mr. Ge Yunbo is really my close friend." All of this moved me very much, and made me feel the power of the seniors to inspire the younger generations. It also made me feel the glory of being a down-to-earth editor.

;

;The above experiences have undoubtedly increased our closeness. When our family went to Nanchang for the first time to visit Mr. Shinan on October 6, 2018, the host and guest were delighted. He held my hand forcefully and held on for a long time. It was not like the hand of a 96-year-old man at all. He can support himself. He also often goes to the library. We all believe that he can easily survive his old age. We look forward to visiting him again. But unexpectedly, I received a text message from Professor Song Lai on August 2, 2021, and learned that Mr. Shinan passed away the night before. I originally wanted to write a sentimental article after learning from the pain, but I was burdened with publishing projects and was unable to do so. This year marks the 100th anniversary of Mr. Shinan's birth. I made up my mind to write a brief statement of my admiration and gratitude for him, so I came up with the above immature commemorative text.

;;2023-11-01 22:00:00;
;

;Recently, a netizen in Loudi, Hunan claimed that his 7-year-old daughter was raped by more than a dozen female classmates in her class during lunch break at school. Bullying and even injuries to the private parts have attracted great attention on the Internet. The local report stated that an investigation confirmed that a female student was involved in a brief brawl, but no intentional harm was found.

;

;On October 28, a parent from Loudi, Hunan Province posted on social media, saying that his 7-year-old daughter was studying in the second grade of a primary school in a township in Loudi, Hunan Province. During lunch break on October 20, she was raped by 16 or 17 girls in her class. The classmates bullied her on the playground. These female classmates not only beat her daughter, but also sexually bullied her, causing injuries to her lower body and causing unbearable pain. Both the school and the parents of the bullying students have a negative attitude toward solving the problem.

;

;Little girls in the second grade collectively bullied their female classmates, especially sexual bullying, which was appalling. People can't help but think of the sexual bullying incident of a 9-year-old primary school student in a bilingual school in Datong, Shanxi that came to light a few months ago. Therefore, the incident quickly became a hot spot on the Internet and attracted great attention.

;

;On October 30, Lengshuijiang City (a county-level city under the jurisdiction of Loudi City), where the incident occurred, issued a situation statement in the name of a joint investigation team, saying that after discovering the relevant video, it immediately established a joint investigation team led by the Municipal Education Bureau , the Public Security Bureau and other departments. After preliminary investigation by the public security department, it was found that the girl involved Zhang and six other female classmates were classmates in the second grade of a primary school in the city; at noon on October 20, because of an incident while skipping rope on the playground There was a dispute and "mutual fighting" occurred for about 1 minute, during which Zhang was "briefly surrounded and slapped" by several other classmates; after monitoring and monitoring was obtained, the girl involved was questioned "protectively", and the witnessing teachers and students were investigated, but no evidence was found. Intentional injury.

;

;The characterization of the incident in this official report is completely different from the accusation made by the victim’s mother. The description of the incident process is also vague and unclear, and there is no clarification on the key issues of the accusation. If the official has sufficient evidence that the girl's parents are exaggerating, they should publicly refute the evidence. Otherwise, not only will it fail to eliminate public doubts, but it will arouse greater doubts.

;

;The first question is whether the girl Zhang’s lower body was injured. According to information released by Zhang's mother, Zhang had multiple soft tissue injuries on his body and his lower body was also injured. He was in unbearable pain when urinating and was forced to hold in his urine. However, although the official report confirmed that "mutual fighting" occurred, it did not mention whether Zhang was injured. This is also the aspect that attracts the most attention from netizens and makes people the most angry. Officials should not shy away from this, they should investigate this and make the results public.

;

;If Zhang’s lower body is indeed injured, then this is a very serious violation of minors. The cause of the injury must be found out. If it involves criminal behavior, he must be severely punished. If Zhang was not injured, then enough credible evidence must be produced to refute the accusations made by the girl’s parents. For example, Zhang can be taken to a tertiary hospital outside Loudi City for examination accompanied by his parents, and the examination results can be announced. If Zhang’s mother exaggerates or lies, she should not avoid it.

;

;Secondly, it is necessary to release the relevant video of the incident that occurred on the playground to set the record straight. Zhang’s mother said that Zhang was beaten by 16 or 17 girls in his class on the playground. The official statement stated that except for Zhang, only six students were involved in the incident, and that several girls were "fighting with each other" for only about a minute, while Zhang was only "briefly surrounded" and "swatted" by several classmates. According to the two sides, not only the number of participants is hugely different, but there is also a huge difference in nature between "beating" and "fighting with each other." Since the official statement mentioned that the police obtained the school's surveillance video, it means that the incident was recorded, and it was not the "aging surveillance" mentioned by the school in Zhang's mother's post. Since there is a video, it should be made public in its entirety so that the public can judge for themselves whether it was a "beating" or a "fighting", how long it lasted, and whether there was any "intentional harm."

;

;Of course, for the sake of protecting minors, minors who can be identified in the video can be treated with protective techniques, such as mosaic, blurred faces, etc., but it should be ensured that several minors can be seen. The individual's involvement in the incident, and the extent of the "ruffling" involved.

;

;It seems a bit incredible that a 7-year-old girl would bully her classmates and also be sexually involved. But it's not impossible. In a bullying incident at a bilingual school in Datong, Shanxi, the bully was only 9 years old. This was not the first time that bullying had occurred, it had also started in the second grade.

;

;There is a stereotype that bullies in school are boys. In fact, this is not the case. Among school violence incidents, the proportion of women committing violence is not low. In March 2023, a bullying incident broke out in Hainan in which a 13-year-old girl was beaten and humiliated by a group of same-sex peers. When the Datong incident attracted great attention, criminal law teacher Cai also received news that a female classmate was bullied by other female classmates in the dormitory, and also engaged in sexual behavior, and the perpetrator even took a video.

;

;In the early years, CCTV reported on a study and found that more than 80% of the perpetrators of school bullying videos posted on the Internet were women. Of course, this may be related to the fact that female bullies are more likely to take videos and upload them online to humiliate their victims, but it also shows that female perpetrators of school violence are by no means uncommon. Moreover, among the campus bullying committed by women, many of them are a group of people bullying one person, and the targets of their bullying are mostly women. Also, among the bullying committed by women, a high proportion involves sexual humiliation, such as being forced to strip naked and take photos. This may be because it creates a stronger sense of shame for the victim. These characteristics of female bullying are consistent with the accusations made by the mother of the victim in the Loudi incident that more than a dozen girls beat and sexually bullied her daughter. This is one of the reasons why netizens are more willing to believe victims’ accusations.

;

;This matter has attracted great attention on the Internet, and the official understatement of the situation is obviously difficult to convince the public. This reminds people of the sexual bullying incident at a bilingual school in Datong, Shanxi. The school and the authorities tried to turn the incident into a minor matter, but in the end, the bullying incident was confirmed. The same is true for this suspected bullying incident in Loudi. If the authorities have sufficient evidence to support their account of the situation, they should make it public promptly to refute the accusations made by the girl's parents.

; Wed, 01 Nov 2023 22:25:03 +0800 舒徐礼乐自圆融：礼学宗师沈文倬先生小记http://www.infzm.com/contents/259627
;;2023-11-01 20:30:00;
;

;;

;

;Shen Wenzhuo (1917-2009), a contemporary master of rituals and a famous Confucian scholar, dedicated his life to Studying the study of the three rites, he has made outstanding achievements in many fields such as etiquette, history of Confucian classics, philology, inscriptions on oracle bones, bibliography, and compilation of ancient books. In particular, the study of the "three rites" has solved many problems in the history of etiquette and Confucian classics. Many unresolved problems were highly praised by Gu Jiegang. The picture was taken in May 1986. ;;

;

;Mr. Shen Wenzhuo (1917-2009) was an "invisible man" at Hangzhou University. In October 1978, I entered the Chinese Department as an undergraduate student. He once gave us a few lectures on "Common Knowledge of Ancient Culture" in the "Ancient Chinese" class, but no one had much impression of him. When I was in graduate school, he was a member of the mentor group, and I started to get to know him.

;

;The headquarters of Hangzhou University (today’s Xixi Campus of Zhejiang University) in the early 1980s was small in area. Tall plane trees stretched out towards the boulevard, forming domes, showing the history of this campus. years. In the southeast corner are several rows of four-story buildings made of blue-grey bricks. The teachers' dormitory and the graduate student dormitory face each other. Between the two floors is the boiler room, where the fire roars in the morning and we go there every day to turn on the water. In autumn and winter, the sycamore leaves have faded to gray, and the walkways of the boiler room are covered with finely crushed coal ash. Against the blue-grey brick walls, the vision is gray.

;

;At that time, Mr. Shen lived in a room on the first floor of the first unit of Building No. 1, about fifteen or six square meters, opposite the public toilet. It was humid in spring, sultry in summer, and cold in winter. . There was no kitchen, so he could only light a fire in the corridor, so for more than 20 years, he had been eating in the canteen, occasionally cooking hoof bones and the like to improve his life. It wasn't until 1986 that he was assigned a two-bedroom house and moved out of here (in July of that year, he was approved as a doctoral supervisor by the State Council's Discipline Review Group).

;

;I have never entered his residence, but every time I pass by, I will stop for a moment. Later, I visited his door many times in my dreams. Through the glass above the door, I seemed to see the banners on the wall, but I couldn't always see clearly what was inside. It was like his personality and education were very mysterious and hard to see clearly. .

;

;I often meet him on the way to the cafeteria. He was over sixty years old at that time, with a broad forehead, sparse hair, and a gray beard, but his face was very rosy. He is not tall, but very strong. In winter, he put on an old gray smock over his old cotton-padded jacket, and carried a shallow bamboo basket in his left hand, which also looked like a dustpan. His big hands had thick knuckles. He always had a smile on his face and seemed to be moving as he walked on the road, making a slight "huffing" sound in his mouth. If he encounters the gaze of others, he responds with a smile in his eyes, his mouth seems to be moving, but he does not speak. He looked gentle and calm, yet as deep as the ocean. He beams with energy when he smiles, inspiring passers-by. So I think he was in a good mood at that time.

;

;What we "new" graduate students often talked about at that time was our own supervisors and each other's supervisors: which field we mainly worked in, what books we published, where we published papers, and what we heard about them. What are the requirements for students, what are the mantras, what new things were said in class...proudly introduce the findings of the instructor, share with each other, and listen carefully to other people's additions and discussions.

;

;Roommate Chen Shenyong is the first graduate student led by Mr. Shen Wenzhuo. My understanding of Mr. Shen gradually enriched through classmate Sheng Yong’s admiring explanations and everyone’s discussions.

;

;;

;

;From left: Fang Jianxin, Mr. Shen, Li Jiemin, Wang Yunlu (photographed in 1997). ;;

;

;Mr. Shen Wenzhuo, whose courtesy name is Fengsheng and nickname is Yinan, is from Wujiang, Jiangsu. He entered a private school when he was young, and studied by himself when he was older, without obtaining any diploma. In his early years, he studied ancient Chinese poetry from Shen Chang, and studied literature and history from Jin Tianhe and Yao Tingjie. In the early 1940s, he specialized in the study of "Three Rites" from Cao Yuanbi and became his close disciple, teaching and mentoring him for nine years. Cao Yuanbi (1867-1954), known as the last outstanding Confucian scholar of the Qing Dynasty, was already in his seventies, so he placed high hopes on Shen Wenzhuo: "If you observe well, you can expect success."

;

;In 1946, he published He wrote articles such as "Shuo Gao Le" and "Wax" and "Wax", which attracted Gu Jiegang's attention, and he was hired as the deputy editor and reviewer of the National Translation and Translation Center. He was mainly responsible for proofreading classics, compiling summaries, and drafting classics dictionaries.

;

;In 1950, he was sent to study at the Political College of North China People's Revolutionary University in Beijing. In June of the following year, he was assigned to Shanghai Library as deputy director of the Cataloging Department. The "Zhongshu Zonglu" we often consult, which is three very thick volumes and is more than a foot high when stacked, was compiled under his leadership. In 1960, the editorial team of "Zonglu" was rated as an advanced collective in Shanghai. As the team leader, he attended the Shanghai Heroes Meeting as a representative.

;

;In February 1963, at the invitation of Professor Jiang Liangfu, he was transferred to the Language and Literature Research Office of the Zhejiang Branch of the Chinese Academy of Sciences (located at Hangzhou University, with Xia Chengtao as the director) as a full-time researcher and went to Hangzhou alone.

;

;In March, as soon as I arrived in Hangzhou, I went to pay a visit to Mr. Ma Yifu; in late April, I went again. "From now on, we will learn to pay homage to our predecessors and scholars, and when we meet each other, we should treat relatives with respect and be harmonious." I had some enlightenment and thought, and wrote "Jiangzhuang Wen Xue Ji" to record it. After autumn, he went to the Northeastern Institute of Literature and History in Changchun to teach "Etiquette" and returned to Hangzhou in the winter. I wanted to visit again, but I couldn't.

;

;The following year, "the trend of talking about ancient studies came to an abrupt end, and the interest was greatly reduced." Soon, I went to the countryside to participate in the "Social Education Movement" and stayed in a commune in my hometown of Zhuji County.

;

;Previously, he had published many papers in "Archaeology" (1961, 1963). It is said that Mr. Guo Moruo, then president of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, spoke highly of him after seeing him.

;

;After the "Cultural Revolution" occurred, the research office was disbanded, and he transferred to the Chinese Department of Hangzhou University and worked as a document clerk in the department's reference room. Because of his extensive knowledge and strong memorization, his colleagues were shocked to call him a "walking dictionary". He lived alone in silence, but never stopped studying etiquette.

;

;In 1974, he was arranged to go to Anji to participate in the "Agricultural and Forestry Class" of the last "May 7th" Cadre School of Hangzhou University. He worked as a "Duck Commander" during the day and explored the secrets of etiquette at night.

;

;In March 1975, four types of works, including the "Review of the Han Bamboo Bamboo Bamboo Slips Unearthed in Wuwei", were sent to Mr. Gu Jiegang for review. Gu Fuxin said that "Taituan is actually the first person in the contemporary world to organize the Book of Rites", but at the same time he lamented that he didn't know when these results would be available. The above words were only circulated within a small circle at that time and were not known to the outside world.

;

;;

;

;Gu Jiegang replied to Shen Wenzhuo's letter. ;;

;

;By the end of the "Cultural Revolution", the situation had changed again. In 1979, he transferred to teaching position. The following year, he was rated as an associate researcher at the age of 64. Our 1982 graduate student is his first enrollment.

;

;At that time, Hangzhou University highly regarded the "Literature and History" of Zhonghua Book Company and the "Chinese Literature and History Series" of Shanghai Ancient Books as the top journals in the field of ancient literature and history, and Mr. Shen was a frequent reader. Among them, "A Brief Discussion on the Practice of Rituals and the Writing of Books on Rituals" (Wenshi, Series 15 and 16, 1983) states that "the practice of rituals existed earlier than written records", thus clarifying the relationship between rituals and ritual books. Mr. Yang Xiangkui later called this article "a monumental work with unprecedented achievements." Another example is the article "The Enrollment of the Twelve Doctors of Huanglong and the Establishment of the Taixue Prefecture and State School" (1983), which analyzes the complex historical facts of the establishment of the Doctor of Confucianism in the Han Dynasty, corrects the mistakes in Pi Xirui's "History of Confucian Studies", and corrects Wang Guowei's "Han and Wei" "Doctoral Examination", thus making a detailed analysis of the rise, fall, increase and lack of doctorates in the three dynasties of Wu, Zhao and Xuan.

;

;Referred to as a later scholar, Mr. Shen's articles have a very broad vision. They have both macroscopic concerns, covering ancient and modern times, and microscopic research, and are as meticulous as hair. At the same time, various methods are used to contain materials, and the amount of information is huge. He has unique insights into almost any issue in traditional etiquette, and almost every sentence in his article embodies the result of his thinking. His narrative language is very elegant and can be almost seamlessly connected with the cited documents, which is a state that is difficult to achieve. I also deeply agree with this.

;

;However, I did not seriously read Mr. Shen’s works and papers at that time, and I was afraid to read them because they were too profound. I have only read his column in "Chinese Literature and History", titled "The Secret of Rituals". Sometimes several articles are published in one issue, and the length is only one or two pages, and the explanation is one word or one thing. , are all explanations of difficult issues, and are of great relevance to the study of literature and history. The elegant and concise writing impressed me endlessly. He has been writing this kind of short essays since 1946, and he has accumulated a lot of copper from the mountains. Many years later, he compiled it into a book, still named as a column. It was only a thin volume with more than 100,000 words, but it was well received.

;

;;

;

;Mr. Shen Wenzhuo is in the study. ;(Information picture/picture);

;

;When I started learning to write papers, I knew that short papers were the most difficult to write because they were hundreds of words long. , more than a thousand words, how difficult it is to ask a real question, list the materials and explain it clearly! It is said that Mr. Shen's other book, "An Interpretation of Different Texts on Chinese Bamboo Slips of "Li"", had more than 400,000 words when it was written. He was not in a hurry to publish it and repeatedly compressed it. When it was finally published, it only had 160,000 words. When we were graduate students (1982.9-1985.6), except for some papers, he had no published works. His first monograph, "An Examination of Zongzhou Rites and Music Civilization," is actually a collection of his essays. It was only published in 1999. The writing spanned more than 40 years, and the total number was only 14 articles. He was already an octogenarian by then.

;

;Mr. Shen has always been indifferent to fame and fortune. He said: "It is not easy to manage the classics and rituals. Only when the mind is clear of 'devil obstacles' and the mind is as clear as water, can one focus on learning and become more general." In fact, he did not write much in his life, but scholars praised him as "the master of rituals." , because his articles do not rely on accumulation of quantity, but win on quality. Each of his articles solves an unsolved problem in history. Cumulatively, it is breathtaking and even more admirable.

;

;We are very fortunate that Mr. Shen opened a class specifically for us. At that time, we were five graduate students, guided by five tutors. Each of them taught three classes, which constituted a semester's graduate course. Even Teacher Guo Zaiyi attended his three classes and sat in the back row.

;

;Mr. Shen has suffered from a severe stutter since he was a child. It is very difficult for him to even speak a complete sentence. This is why he rarely attends classes.

;

;The content the teachers taught at that time was self-selected and derived from years of deep thinking. In my impression, Mr. Shen Wenzhuo talked about issues related to various schools of thought in the pre-Qin period and ancient and modern texts. In my limited knowledge at that time, "Lun", "Mencius", "Lao" and "Zhuang" were independent writings, and I had a little dabbling in them. I had never read "Mozi", and I dared not touch "Li" and "Shu". As for each There is no understanding of the relationship between families. Mr. Shen's class revealed the intricate relationships between various schools of thought, especially the Jixia School and the famous schools. These schools, which had few works handed down to the world, used to dominate the competition with other schools, making other schools Each school had to respond and adjust; some schools that disappeared had their doctrines integrated by other schools and passed down to later generations. This made me suddenly understand that each argument was not a complete and systematic explanation of a certain theory, but an expression of its own views on the opponent. If you don't know the background of this debate, you will feel that its argument is extremely biased, like It's fighting against the air, I don't know why.

;

;This is very much like when I play center on the basketball court. Every time I hit hard, I have to push the person behind me away so that I can turn over and score the ball. You have to know how powerful the "top" is to understand how much effort it takes for me to "rely on". If the person behind me is blurred, and people only see me turning backwards and forward into the air, they will definitely laugh at me for using too much brute force, which is the so-called "biased approach".

;

;In our classroom, Mr. Shen burst out each word from his mouth vigorously. Some words took him two or three times to complete, so he wiped the sweat with a handkerchief. Still mouthing. When he talks about happy things, he will also chuckle. He first used his own research and explanation to redefine the old concepts, and then extended them to put forward new definitions for a series of issues. As a result, the related characters, events, schools and theories were swept away from the long-accumulated dust and revealed. A completely different appearance.

;

;We all listened attentively, lest we miss a syllable. Because the words that burst out one by one were like formation symbols flying in the air, forming a wonderful formation from which the truth of history emerged. The formation was so turbulent, with forces coming and going, waves vying with each other, sounds and principles echoing each other. This was the era of a hundred schools of thought contending!

;

;More than forty years have passed, and Mr. Shen’s specific explanation left only a few impressions on me. For example, “Book of Rites” is later than “Lidian”; "Jinwen" refers to Han Li, who explains the inheritance of various texts in the Han Dynasty from the perspective of the characters used in writing the texts; someone's interpretation is established as an academic official, which is "learning from the law" before it is established. , it is "Family Law"... Most of the other specific knowledge has been forgotten now. Only his "chichi" voice occasionally still rings in my ears, so the feeling caused by his explanation came again. It flowed through my brain like a tide, making me feel an inexplicable shock. More importantly, through these explanations, I understand that I must look through the surface of documents to feel the "forces" and their interactions behind the times, in order to vaguely see the "invisible hand" of God.

;

;After meeting Mr. Ma Yifu, Mr. Shen wrote a poem:

;

;;Confucian Classics and Interpretation Canon 1 Furnace melting, ;

;

;;Prove that the mind is the same and the same. ;

;

;;Goodness, beauty, depth and subtle appearance can be understood in different ways,;

;

;;Shu Xu's rituals and music are harmonious. ;

;

;Also recorded: "Mr. (Ma) knew about Yu's etiquette for treating Ji Dan, and he expressed the purpose of the etiquette, kindness and beauty, and was amazed by it. I also introduced the meaning of 'Shu Xu', No matter how hard you look at Mr. Shen, don’t dismiss him with different opinions.”

;

;Now I recall Mr. Shen’s three classes, record every bit of what I saw and heard at that time, and respectfully take his last sentence as title to express my memory.

;Pingxiang Economic and Technological Development Zone was established in 1992 and upgraded to a national-level economic and technological development in 2010 district. ;(Southern Weekend reporter Zhai Xingli/Photo);

;

;"This is a major choice in my life." In April 2023, Zhang Shichun chose Give up his status within the system and stay to work in a large state-owned enterprise in Pingxiang Economic and Technological Development Zone, Jiangxi Province.

;

;Previously, he had worked in this state-owned enterprise for 4 years, but retained the establishment of a public institution.

;

;In April 2023, Pingxiang Economic Development Zone announced the cancellation of 19 self-established institutions and the dismissal of 247 self-employed section-level cadres based on the personnel system reform plan adopted by the Pingxiang Municipal Party Committee and Municipal Government.

;

;A considerable part of the dismissed personnel were originally on-staff personnel. After their self-employed positions in the Economic and Technological Development Zone are dismissed, they can choose to retain the establishment and have the Economic and Technological Development Zone coordinate the arrangement of new jobs, or they can Give up the establishment and work in an enterprise. The dismissed persons who were originally non-staff personnel can participate in the full-scale competition for recruitment, or they can choose to resign.

;

;Zhang Shichun is a department-level cadre self-employed by Pingxiang Economic Development Zone. Facing the reform, he has two choices. Abandon the establishment." After a family meeting, he decided to stay in the business.

;

;The reasons why Zhang Shichun became a self-employed cadre are not complicated. As one of the earliest economic development zones established in China, after 31 years of development, the population of Pingxiang Economic Development Zone has increased from the initial 10,000 to about 250,000 now, and its functions have also expanded from solely economic development to taking into account social management and public affairs. Services, etc., have set up their own management agencies, established their own positions, and hired their own personnel during the development process. This has both objective reasons and subjective reasons such as previous organizational establishment management was not standardized and personnel were highly arbitrary. This is also a common phenomenon in domestic development zones.

;

;In March 2023, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council issued the "Plan for the Reform of Party and State Institutions", clarifying that both the central and local governments must streamline their staffing. On this basis, many places have begun to clear out non-staff personnel. Harbin City in Heilongjiang Province, Shiyan City in Hubei Province, Chuxiong Prefecture in Yunnan Province, Huizhou City in Guangdong Province, Zhuzhou City in Hunan Province and other places have introduced plans to clear out non-staff personnel.

;

;Pingxiang Economic Development Zone has comprehensively standardized personnel management. Among the 247 dismissed cadres, 63 people who were illegally borrowed were dismissed, 17 people were dismissed, and another 8 people gave up their business establishment to work in enterprises. After the reform, all employees will implement "host management" (a personnel management method in which staff and non-staff staff are hired as hosts at all levels), rather than simply "throwing out" non-staff staff.

;

;;The fired deputy minister;

;

;Zhang Shichun, who was born in 1970, worked as a teacher for 10 years after joining the workforce. His original identity was in the professional establishment. After leaving school, Zhang Shichun worked in the Education Bureau. In 1997, he was transferred to Pingxiang Economic Development Zone and later became deputy director of the Party and Mass Work Department of the Economic and Technological Development Zone Party Working Committee.

;

;In 2019, due to work needs, Zhang Shichun was adjusted to a large state-owned enterprise in the Economic Development Zone as deputy secretary of the party committee and secretary of the Discipline Inspection Commission, and the establishment was still retained in the Party and Mass Work Department of the Economic Development Zone.

;

;“There were quite a lot of situations like Shichun at that time.” Yu Zhifeng, deputy director of the Party and Mass Work Department, explained that from the economic development zone agencies to working in enterprises, there are still such personnel established by the agencies. , seven or eight in total. State-owned enterprises do not have public institutions, but they still retain the status of public institutions and are self-employed department-level cadres in the Economic Development Zone.

;

;Self-employment means self-employment. Without filing with the superior organizational department, the superior organizational department will not recognize it. If a civil servant or public servant is appointed as a deputy section-level cadre through normal organizational procedures, the superior organizational department needs to register for it, but the Economic Development Zone hires him to a full-section level without filing with the superior organizational department based on work needs. In fact, His rank is still deputy section level.

;

;In 2020 and 2022, the Jiangxi Provincial Party Committee inspection team pointed out this problem during its two inspections of Pingxiang. Take 2022 as an example. In April of that year, the Fourth Inspection Team of the Provincial Party Committee inspected Pingxiang. On July 28, the Fourth Inspection Team reported the inspection situation to the Party Working Committee of Pingxiang Economic Development Zone. The third of the four main opinions was on the economic development. In the organizational work of the open area, “there is a big gap in improving the organizational system that is connected from top to bottom and has strong execution.” The inspection team put forward suggestions and suggestions for rectification, "focusing on solving key issues in the personnel field of the institution."

;

;Yu Zhifeng introduced that the more prominent problems in the personnel field of the Economic Development Zone are that there are too many self-established institutions and too many self-employed cadres: after years of development, the number of self-employed section-level cadres in the Economic Development Zone has reached 247. There are three main categories: on-staff personnel in the Economic Development Zone, cadres transferred from higher-level agencies or brother districts and counties, and self-employed non-staff personnel in the Economic and Technological Development Zone.

;

;After the personnel reform work was launched, the Economic Development Zone organized relevant leading cadres to conduct one-on-one interviews with the 247 self-employed cadres, led by the main leaders of the Economic Development Zone Party Working Committee. Yu Zhifeng said that the one-on-one conversations lasted for several months, mainly to explain the urgency of policies and reforms, and to "patiently and meticulously do the ideological work of the dismissal target." For self-employed cadres who are already on staff, we should give them the right to choose whether to give up their staff and choose to work in enterprises or retain their staff and work in government agencies.

;

;Zhang Shichun prefers to give up his official position and stay in the company, but he also made it clear to his family the risks of working in the company: once the company encounters difficulties in its development, his income will also drop, and may even Unemployment, "After discussion, we finally decided that I would stay in the company. I also believe that the company will develop better after the reform of the Economic Development Zone."

;

;In fact, Yu Zhifeng, who carried out the dismissal work, was also a self-employed cadre. Before his dismissal, he served as party branch secretary and deputy director of the Party and Mass Work Department. After his dismissal, he remained the business editor, but only retained the position of deputy director of the Party and Mass Affairs Department.

;

;;"Little horse and big cart";

;

;While dismissing 247 self-employed cadres, Pingxiang Economic Development Zone also dissolved and merged 19 self-established institutions , including the District Political and Legal Committee, District State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission, District Letters and Calls Bureau, etc. Yu Zhifeng explained, “In the course of the development of the Economic Development Zone for many years, with the continuous increase in social affairs and service population, the Economic Development Zone set up its own institutions and hired a large number of cadres in violation of regulations without obtaining the consent of superiors.”< /p>;

;Pingxiang Economic and Technological Development Zone was established in 1992. It was upgraded to a provincial development zone in 1995 and a national economic and technological development zone in 2010. After the area adjustment and expansion at the end of December 2021, the total area under its jurisdiction is 119 square kilometers. The permanent population is about 250,000.

;

;As of June 2021, there are 230 national-level economic and technological development zones. The GDP of Pingxiang Economic and Technological Development Zone has been ranked among the top 100 economic and technological development zones in the country for five consecutive years, ranking 62nd in the country in 2022.

;

;Like other economic development zones across the country, Pingxiang Economic Development Zone is also a dispatched agency of the municipal government and is a functional area rather than an administrative district. "At the beginning of its establishment, the functions of the economic and technological development zone were single, mainly economic development tasks, so the higher-level departments approved a small establishment for the economic and technological development zone." Zhu Min, director of the Party and Mass Department of the Party Working Committee of Pingxiang Economic and Technological Development Zone, told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Materials provided by the Economic and Technological Development Zone to Southern Weekend reporters show that the specific regional scope was not delineated at the beginning of the economic and technological development zone. After it was upgraded to a provincial development zone in 1995, the Pingxiang Municipal Government decided to divide the six The administrative village is designated as a direct development area with a development area of ​​10 square kilometers.

;

;“With such an area and population, the Economic Development Zone did not need much establishment at that time.” Zhu Min said, but in the process of development, the area of ​​Pingxiang Economic Development Zone gradually expanded, and with the agglomeration of industries , Pingxiang City’s old urban area population relief and other factors have led to a sharp increase in the population of the Economic Development Zone.

;

;According to official data released by Pingxiang City, the permanent population of the Economic Development Zone has increased from 110,000 in 2011 to 250,000 in 2021. In the same year, the permanent population of Luxi County under the jurisdiction of Pingxiang City was 260,000, and the permanent population of Lianhua County was 210,000. This means that the population managed by the Economic Development Zone is equivalent to that of an ordinary county town in Pingxiang City. In terms of economic scale, the 2022 New Year's message of the Pingxiang Economic Development Zone shows that the economic development zone completed a regional GDP of 22.3159 billion yuan in the first three quarters of 2021, ranking first in Pingxiang City.  

;

;How many establishments does the Pingxiang Economic Development Zone have, which manages a population of 250,000? Zhu Min introduced that in 2022, the superior establishment department re-examined the establishment of the Economic Development Zone Management Committee. There are currently 102 public employees and 138 business employees, for a total of 240 employees. Southern Weekend reporters learned from authoritative channels that a certain district in a surrounding city has more than 700 civil servants and more than 1,000 public servants.

;

;In order to cope with the increasing social management functions as the population and regional area continue to increase, Pingxiang Economic Development Zone began to set up its own institutions.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters learned that there are basically two situations when economic and technological development zones set up their own institutions: population growth creates social management needs, and they must set up their own institutions to provide public services; municipal functional departments have vertical management needs , requiring the Economic and Technological Development Zone to set up corresponding institutions for work docking.

;

;For example, the Economic and Technological Development Zone has set up five social work bureaus, each of which manages several administrative villages. In fact, it performs the functions of the township government or city sub-district office; the Urban Management Bureau of the Economic and Technological Development Zone, The establishment of the Garden Management Bureau was because the Pingxiang City Urban Management Bureau and the Garden Management Bureau required the Economic Development Zone to also set up a management agency to facilitate the unified planning and implementation of urban management and gardening work in Pingxiang city.

;

;There are also some self-established institutions set up by the Economic Development Zone to coordinate line work. The Public Security Bureau of the Economic Development Zone is the Development Zone branch established by the Pingxiang Municipal Public Security Bureau. The prosecutorial functions are performed by the Procuratorate in the Development Zone established by the Pingxiang Municipal Procuratorate. The judicial institution is hosted by the Anyuan District Court and the Development Zone Tribunal is established. In order to coordinate the work of public prosecutors, prosecutors and law enforcement as well as petitions, inspections and comprehensive management, the Economic Development Zone has set up its own political and legal committee.

;

;After 31 years of development and construction, the Economic Development Zone has become a functional area with a high degree of industry-city integration. The functions of the Economic Development Zone Management Committee have shifted from single to comprehensive, and in fact are performing functions similar to those of district and county governments. . During an interview with a reporter from Southern Weekend, a major leader of the Economic Development Zone analyzed that with the current establishment and number of personnel, the Economic and Technological Development Zone's ability to perform all management functions is a bit like a "small horse and a big cart".

;

;;“Lock the entrance and keep the exit smooth”;

;

;Although there are too many self-established institutions and self-employed cadres, it is necessary for actual work, but it is also a matter of organizational personnel management. Caused by insufficient standards, too many agencies and cadres have also produced many adverse consequences.

;

;“In terms of cadre team building, the superior organizational departments do not recognize the self-employed cadres of the Economic Development Zone, which has a negative impact on the growth of cadres. This is objectively not conducive to the training of cadres.” Yu Zhifeng explained.

;

;Zhu Min served in the Organization Department of the Pingxiang Municipal Party Committee before being transferred to the Economic Development Zone as the director of the Party and Mass Work Department. In 2019, Zhu Min went to work in the first cadre section of the Organization Department of the Pingxiang Municipal Party Committee and was responsible for contacting the Economic Development Zone. “At that time, I raised the issue of irregular organizational work in the Economic Development Zone and too many self-established institutions.”

;

;In 2021, the Pingxiang Municipal Party Committee and the Municipal Government vigorously promoted the reform of the personnel system of the Pingxiang Economic Development Zone. The Municipal Party Committee Organization Department, the Municipal Party Committee Editorial Office, the Municipal Development and Reform Commission and other departments took the lead in organizing outings to learn from the experience of personnel reforms in economic development zones in other regions. . By 2022, the advancement of personnel reform will be significantly intensified.

;

;The 11th issue of "China Institutional Reform and Management" magazine in 2021 published a signed article "Pingxiang promotes standardized management of non-staff personnel" written and edited by the Pingxiang Municipal Party Committee. The article summarizes Pingxiang City’s work experience in cleaning up non-staff personnel. The overall principle is to integrate non-staff personnel and on-staff personnel into total management. The institutional establishment department shall approve the number of non-staff personnel based on the department’s functions and staffing situation. We must resolutely clean up the non-staff personnel employed in the post, and standardize the management of the non-staff personnel employed within the post.

;

;The article also summarizes the direction of the use of non-staff personnel. It is prohibited to use non-staff personnel for administrative examination and approval, administrative law enforcement, archives management, political personnel, letters and visits, and confidentiality-related positions; insisting on "doing things without hiring people" In principle, employers are not allowed to use non-staff personnel for property management, security, greening maintenance, canteen services, information network services, public building facilities and equipment maintenance, etc., except for primary and secondary schools and kindergarten canteens, and all use market service outsourcing, The government purchases services.

;

;In fact, the cleanup of non-staff employees in the Economic Development Zone is also carried out within the framework of the above principles.

;

;After the personnel system reform in April 2023, the Economic and Technological Development Zone implemented overall control of posts based on the personnel system reform plan approved by the Pingxiang Municipal Party Committee and Municipal Government. On this basis, the Economic Development Zone further stipulated that in accordance with the requirements of the general staff control, no new non-staff personnel will be added in the future, and only personnel within the establishment quota will be recruited.

;

;“Lock the entrance of non-staff personnel into the Economic Development Zone, strengthen the assessment and management of existing personnel, implement the last elimination system, and smooth the exit.” Zhu Min said.

;

;;It is by no means “sweeping out”;

;

;When dismissing self-employed cadres, the Economic Development Zone’s main concern is causing excessive reactions from the dismissal targets.

;

;Zhu Min reported on the reform plan to the main leaders of the Pingxiang Municipal Party Committee, "The leader emphasized the general direction: the purpose of the reform is not to destroy your Economic Development Zone, the Economic Development Zone is still the engine of Pingxiang's economic development ."

;

;After dismantling and merging 19 self-established agencies, the work was reorganized and the functions of the dismantled agencies were merged into 8 offices including the Party and Government Office of the Economic Development Zone, the Economic Development Bureau, and the Social Development Bureau. It has internal institutions and 8 public institutions including the park enterprise service center and social governance center.

;

;In addition, the Economic Development Zone breaks down the identity boundaries and implements a unified "sponsoring system management" for both staff and non-staff personnel. It does not distinguish whether they are on staff or not, only based on the position. The sponsorship is divided into 12 levels. Each level is divided into 12 levels. Levels correspond to different salaries. The host has a promotion and downgrade mechanism, and has set an annual assessment failure rate of 5%. It is clear that those who fail the assessment for two consecutive years will be eliminated directly, so that the host level can be moved up or down, and the salary and performance can be improved or reduced.

;

;In Zhu Min’s view, the economic development zone’s gradual digestion of non-staff personnel is by no means simply “sweeping them out”, but using a sponsorship system to allow the remaining staff and non-staff personnel to compete on the same track, “Whether it is Whether within the system or outside the system, opportunities must be given to these young people."

;

;During the Southern Weekend reporter’s interview, the Economic Development Zone was conducting a survey. The theme was to explore a new mechanism for motivating cadres, and to build a competitive system through competition, job transfer, waiting for job, demotion, dismissal, etc. selection mechanism. Southern Weekend reporters asked several organizers of the Economic Development Zone for confirmation. They said that after the organizational reform, the work pace is faster, the work intensity is higher, and the work pressure is greater. After the National Day holiday in 2023, many organizers have been working continuously and can basically only take half a day off on weekends.

;

;Another reason is that after the organization was dissolved and personnel were eliminated, the social management functions of the original organization were not completely divested, and various functions were divided into newly established public institutions. Therefore, the overall work The amount has not decreased.

;

;However, with the arrival of the next round of reforms, economic and technological development zones across the country may usher in a functional "downsizing."

;

;The "High-Quality Development Plan for Development Zones in Anhui Province's "14th Five-Year Plan"" released in March 2022 has a special chapter discussing the reform of the development zone system and mechanism, focusing on the rational division of development zone management agencies , territorial governments, and development and operation companies have real power.

;

;In July 2023, the "Regulations on Promoting High-Quality Development of Development Zones in Henan Province (Draft)" was submitted to the Standing Committee of the Henan Provincial People's Congress for its first review. The draft clarified that the Management Committee is mainly responsible for policy formulation, development planning, Administrative management functions such as administrative approval, investment promotion, and corporate services do not mention social management functions.

;

;The statements in both places send a signal: the functional positioning of development zones at the provincial level may still be economic development. So, how to deal with the social management functions that are gradually increasing in the development process of development zones in various places?

;

;Southern Weekend reporters learned that in the national overall plan for the next round of institutional reform of development zones across the country, straightening out the relationship between development zones and administrative regions and gradually stripping away social affairs management functions is one of the trends.

;On October 30, the Gome headquarters was empty. ;(Southern Weekend reporter Mei Ling/Photo);

;

;Pengrun Building, located at No. 26 Xiaoyun Road, East Third Ring Road, Beijing, was once a The top-level office building with the largest single area in Asia is close to the Embassy District and Chaoyang Park. This is also where the headquarters of Gome Electric Appliances is located.

;

;Since its opening in 2000, this 36-story light blue building with an apron on the top floor has witnessed the founder of Gome Huang Guangyu become the richest man in China three times, and now it has witnessed the rise of Gome The embarrassing situation of electrical appliances due to losses, payment arrears, and wage arrears.

;

;In mid-October, on the lottery page of the Gome APP, a pop-up window targeting Gome founder Huang Guangyu and current Gome Chairman Huang Xiuhong appeared, including "arrears of wages and arrears of payment." In fact, issues such as wage arrears at Gome have already emerged as early as 2022, and angry employees clashed with Huang Guangyu in Pengrun Building.

;

; "To what extent have employees been forced to do pop-up windows? Now Gome is in a state of no one's supervision, and employees can only find windows by themselves." Leaving Gome in Beijing in March 2023 Zhao Qiang, an employee at the headquarters, told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;;Yuan;;How did you get to where you are today;;? ;

;

;Huang Guangyu was born in Chaoshan, Guangdong, and is 54 years old. According to official information from Gome Group, Huang Guangyu established the first "Gome Electrical Appliances Store" with an area of ​​less than 100 square meters on Zhushikou Street, Qianmen, Beijing, in 1987. Gome's retail road officially started.

;

;In 1990, Gome tried a new supply and marketing model, breaking away from middlemen and directly underwriting customization with manufacturers, launching a "direct sales" home appliance model. In 1993, Gome unified its store names, product display methods, store after-sales services, and publicity, becoming the prototype of China's retail chain model.

;

;In 2004, Gome Electric Appliances was successfully listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange through a backdoor approach. Huang Guangyu used this to reach the top of the Hurun Report as the richest man in mainland China with a net worth of tens of billions, and he aspired to the top spot again in 2005 and 2008. , personal wealth once reached 45 billion yuan.

;

;In November 2008, Huang Guangyu, who was at his peak, was detained by the police on suspicion of economic crimes.

;

;Two years later, Huang Guangyu was sentenced to 14 years in prison for illegal business crimes, insider trading and unit bribery. In June 2020, the Beijing No. 1 Intermediate People's Court ruled that Huang Guangyu should be paroled in accordance with the law. In February 2021, Huang Guangyu was officially released from prison after serving his sentence.
